channel.title: NPR Topics: Economy
channel.description: NPR news on the U.S. and world economy, the World Bank, and Federal Reserve. Commentary on economic trends. Subscribe to NPR Economy podcasts and RSS feeds.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Hiring slows in December to end the weakest year of job growth since the pandemic
item.description: U.S. employers added 50,000 jobs in December, according to a report from the Labor Department Friday. Measured annually, job gains in 2025 were the slowest since 2020.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. employers added 50,000 jobs in December, according to a report from the Labor Department Friday. Measured annually, job gains in 2025 were the slowest since 2020.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: U.S. population growth is slowing. The immigration crackdown is a major factor
item.description: Congressional forecasters have lowered their projection for U.S. population growth over the next decade by 7 million people as a result of the Trump administration's immigration crackdown as well as falling birth rates.
item.content:encoded:
Congressional forecasters have lowered their projection for U.S. population growth over the next decade by 7 million people as a result of the Trump administration's immigration crackdown as well as falling birth rates.

(Image credit: Ryan Murphy)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: It's not just oil: How else Wall Street might benefit from Trump's Venezuela actions
item.description: Oil companies and their shareholders may benefit from President Trump's military action in Venezuela — but it also could benefit many other U.S. investors.
item.content:encoded:
Oil companies and their shareholders may benefit from President Trump's military action in Venezuela — but it also could benefit many other U.S. investors.

(Image credit: TIMOTHY A. CLARY/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Trump says US to get 30 million to 50 million barrels of oil from Venezuela at market price
item.description: Trump pledged to use proceeds from the sale of this oil "to benefit the people" of both countries.
item.content:encoded:
Trump pledged to use proceeds from the sale of this oil "to benefit the people" of both countries.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Attempting to predict the economy in 2026
item.description: Economists may have a pretty dismal record with predictions. But we're still interested in what they see in their non-existent crystal balls.
item.content:encoded:
Economists may have a pretty dismal record with predictions. But we're still interested in what they see in their non-existent crystal balls.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Why the dollar fell over 9% in 2025, and what to expect in 2026
item.description: The dollar fell over 9% in 2025, its worst annual performance since 2017. The declines reflect a volatile year for the U.S. economy, with investors likely facing another unpredictable 12 months.
item.content:encoded: The dollar fell over 9% in 2025, its worst annual performance since 2017. The declines reflect a volatile year for the U.S. economy, with investors likely facing another unpredictable 12 months.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Warren Buffett officially retires as Berkshire Hathaway's CEO
item.description: The legendary 95-year-old investor spent decades building his company into one of the world's largest and most powerful. Now Greg Abel is taking it over.
item.content:encoded:
The legendary 95-year-old investor spent decades building his company into one of the world's largest and most powerful. Now Greg Abel is taking it over.

(Image credit: Chandan Khanna)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: It's the year's biggest economic buzzword, but what exactly is a 'K-shaped' economy?
item.description: We unpack one of the biggest economic buzzwords of 2025: What is a "K-shaped' economy?
item.content:encoded: We unpack one of the biggest economic buzzwords of 2025: What is a "K-shaped' economy?
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha

item.title: The state of the U.S. economy as 2025 draws to a close
item.description: The U.S. economy chugs into the new year in stronger shape than many forecasters had expected. But Americans remain wary about the high cost of living.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. economy chugs into the new year in stronger shape than many forecasters had expected. But Americans remain wary about the high cost of living.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: What is a K-shaped economy?
item.description: In 2025, one of the biggest business buzzwords has been the idea of a "K-shaped" economy, in which there is a growing disparity between the rich and the poor.
item.content:encoded: In 2025, one of the biggest business buzzwords has been the idea of a "K-shaped" economy, in which there is a growing disparity between the rich and the poor.
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha
